intro: Amyema fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered amyema, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Amyema fasciculata is typically found in sandy soils and is adapted to thrive in dry, coastal environments.
